context.need: I'd like to install solar panels on my house and want to know if I need permission to have someone undertake this work.

recommendation.reason: Link appears suitable for user needs
next_steps: Follow the link to access the content

retrieved_content.content:
Sustainability

Broxbourne Borough Council has partnered with … Hertfordshire Climate Change and Sustainability Partnership(opens in new window) to bring Solar Together to Broxbourne’s homeowners.

Solar Together Hertfordshire a group-buying scheme, which brings Hertfordshire households together to get high-quality solar photovoltaic (PV) panels and battery storage at a competitive price.

The scheme is currently taking registrations for when the next application windows opens in 2025. Register your interest … here

The last Solar Together cohort saw 23 solar PV installations and 22 battery installations in Broxbourne. The full Hertfordshire 2023-2024 annual report can be accessed ...

 

Planning Permission

Solar PV installations are considered a 'permitted development' and will generally not need planning permission. However, in some cases, such as in Conservation Areas and on Listed Buildings, planning permission may be required

 

How does it work?

  1. Registration: you can register for free and without obligation via the Solar Together website.
  2. Selection of Installers: Only qualified installers will be selected to participate in the scheme, offering homeowners a range of options for installation.
  3. Installation: Selected installers will carry out surveys and installation of the chosen solar PV system.

 

Why Solar Together?

  • 43 Schemes
  • 300,000 registrants
  • Over 75MW solar power installed
  • Over 22,000 installations
  • Over 250,000 panels installed
  • Over 460,000 tonnes in CO2 avoided
  • £185 million private investment
  • 15-35% savings against the market average.

 

To find out more about the most recent iChoosr Annual report, please check here (note for Comms - please link in here the attached PDF)

 

Help desk support

If you have a question, see the frequently asked questions on the Solar Together website or contact Solar Together using their contact form or call 0800 285 1347 (Monday to Friday between 8am and 5pm).

Reason.need: I'd like to install solar panels on my house and want to know if I need permission to have someone undertake this work.
Reason.reasoning: The content provides information about solar PV installations being considered a 'permitted development' and will generally not need planning permission. However, it mentions exceptions for Conservation Areas and Listed Buildings, suggesting there may be situations where permission is required.
Reason.next_actions: I would contact the local council to confirm if my specific property falls under the exceptions mentioned and requires planning permission.

analysis.overall_assessment: The content provides a good foundation for a Council Resident looking to install solar panels, including details about Solar Together group-buying scheme that offers competitive pricing and quality, registration process, and installation details. However, the lack of specific information about the local council's exact requirements and permits might leave some uncertainties.
